skill.name: gasp-diagnostics
skill.description: System diagnostics using GASP (General AI Specialized Process monitor). Use when user asks about Linux system performance, requests system checks, mentions GASP, asks to diagnose hosts, or says things like "check my system" or "what's wrong with [hostname]". Can actively fetch GASP metrics from hosts via HTTP or interpret provided JSON output.
skill.summary: System diagnostics using GASP (General AI Specialized Process monitor). Use when user asks about Lin...
skill.author: AcceleratedIndustries

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Network access is controlled and documented - HTTP requests to port 8080 only for fetching GASP metrics from specified hostnames. No file system access beyond skill directory, no environment variable reading, no code execution.

content.value_statement: Diagnosing Linux system issues requires expertise in CPU, memory, disk, and network metrics. GASP Diagnostics teaches Claude to fetch GASP monitoring data and interpret it with context-aware analysis.
actual_capabilities: Fetch GASP metrics from any host via HTTP on port 8080
Analyze CPU, memory, disk I/O, network, GPU, and systemd metrics
Compare multiple hosts to identify performance outliers
Detect memory leaks, performance regressions, and bottlenecks
Provide context-aware recommendations based on infrastructure patterns
Interpret GASP JSON output with health summaries and concern prioritization
limitations: Requires GASP to be running on target hosts (port 8080)
Cannot diagnose Windows or macOS systems
Cannot modify system configuration or restart services
Cannot access systems without GASP installed and running

use_cases.title: Multi-host cluster analysis
use_cases.description: Compare resource usage across Proxmox nodes, container hosts, and development workstations to identify performance outliers.

use_cases.title: Memory leak investigation
use_cases.description: Detect memory pressure, swap usage, and identify processes consuming excessive memory with growth trends.

use_cases.title: Workstation performance check
use_cases.description: Diagnose slow development workstations by analyzing GPU utilization, disk I/O bottlenecks, and process patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Single host check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check {hostname} for any issues and tell me what you find.

prompt_templates.title: Compare hosts
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare resource usage on {host1} and {host2}. Which one is the outlier and why?

prompt_templates.title: Memory diagnosis
prompt_templates.prompt: Why is {hostname} slow? Check for memory pressure, swap usage, and identify any memory-hogging processes.

prompt_templates.title: Full diagnostics
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a full diagnostic on {hostname}. Check CPU load, memory pressure, disk I/O, network errors, systemd failed units, and GPU utilization if available.

output: Memory pressure at 8.2% - postgres container using 12GB RAM (up from 4GB baseline)
Swap usage: 512MB - system started swapping 2 hours ago
Recommendation: Check for query leak and consider restarting the container
No failed systemd units, network looks normal

best_practices: Use specific hostnames rather than IP addresses for better context recognition
Ask for multi-host comparison when troubleshooting cluster-wide issues
Check recent_changes array to correlate issues with system events
anti_patterns: Asking about system issues without specifying a host (skill needs GASP endpoint)
Ignoring baseline comparisons when assessing if values are abnormal
Assuming high memory usage is always a problem (cache usage is normal on Linux)

faq.question: What systems does GASP Diagnostics support?
faq.answer: Linux systems with GASP installed and running on port 8080. Tested on Arch Linux, Debian, Ubuntu, and Proxmox.

faq.question: What are the resource limits?
faq.answer: No limits within the skill itself. Depends on GASP configuration on target hosts. The skill can analyze any JSON output GASP produces.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing tools?
faq.answer: Install GASP on hosts, ensure port 8080 is accessible, then symlink the skill directory to your Claude skills folder.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads GASP metrics via HTTP GET requests. No data is written or stored by the skill.

faq.question: What if GASP is unreachable?
faq.answer: The skill handles errors gracefully. It will inform you the host is unreachable and suggest checking if GASP is running.

faq.question: How does this compare to MCP servers?
faq.answer: GASP Diagnostics uses progressive loading (~100 tokens idle vs ~1300+ tokens for MCP). It teaches Claude interpretation logic rather than just fetching data.
